newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MOL SETS UP AUSTRIAN WHOLESALE UNIT.
newsitem.headline: MOL SETS UP AUSTRIAN WHOLESALE UNIT.

text.p: Hungarian oil and gas comapny MOL Rt set up a majority-owned Austrian wholesale unit, MOL Austria GmbH, the company said on Tuesday.
"Mol intends to channel its export sales to the Austrian market through its newly-established subsidiary and further enhance its presence in the country," MOL said in a statement.

MOL Austria GmbH, in which MOL has a 75 percent share, with the rest owned by Austria's Baustoffimportkontor GmbH, is the successor of Mineralkontor, formerly owned 49 percent by MOL and 51 percent by Baustoffimportkontor.
MOL and Baustoffimportkontor concluded the deal on March 28, the statement said.
MOL said last month that it targets a 10 percent market share in Austria as part of its expansion plans in the neighbouring countries.
At 1106 GMT, MOL shares stood at 3,015 forints, down 45, on the Budapest Stock Exchange.
